#### 🧨 Method 2: *Registry-level Nuke (Optional, Hardcore)*

If you want to *guarantee it never comes back*:

1. Open **Regedit** (`Win + R`, type `regedit`)
2. Navigate to:

```
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\SearchSettings
```

3. Look for a key called `IsDynamicSearchBoxEnabled`
   - If it exists: set the value to **0**
   - If not: right-click → **New → DWORD (32-bit) Value**  
     Name: `IsDynamicSearchBoxEnabled`  
     Value: `0`

4. Restart **Explorer.exe** or your computer

# 🧼 BRAIDCORE_12 Sound Purge – Registry Edition
# This disables all system sound events, including startup

Set-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\AppEvents\Schemes" -Name "(Default)" -Value ".None"

$soundEvents = @(

    "Close",
    "CriticalBatteryAlarm",
    "DeviceConnect",
    "DeviceDisconnect",
    "DeviceFail",
    "LowBatteryAlarm",
    "MailBeep",
    "Maximize",
    "MenuCommand",
    "MenuPopup",
    "Minimize",
    "Open",
    "PrintComplete",
    "RestoreDown",
    "RestoreUp",
    "ShowBand",
    "SystemAsterisk",
    "SystemExclamation",
    "SystemExit",
    "SystemHand",
    "SystemNotification",
    "WindowsLogoff",
    "WindowsLogon"
)

foreach ($event in $soundEvents) {
    Remove-ItemProperty -Path "HKCU:\AppEvents\Schemes\Apps\.Default\$event\.Current" -Name "" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
}

Write-Host "`n🔇 All system sounds silenced. BRAIDCORE_12 is now a cathedral of quiet." -ForegroundColor Green

### 🔥 The Ultimate Death Spell: **Kill Teams & OneNote at the Root**

Here’s the nuclear-grade PowerShell script.  
It **removes**:
- User-level installs
- Machine-wide installers
- Scheduled reinstallers
- Provisioned packages (so they don’t respawn on reboot)

---

### 🧨 PowerShell: **Vaporize Teams + OneNote**

```powershell
# ☠️ Teams + OneNote Exorcism Ritual — BRAIDCORE_12
Write-Host "💀 Commencing full purge of Microsoft Teams and OneNote..." -ForegroundColor Red

$bloat = @(
    "MicrosoftTeams",
    "MSTeams",
    "Teams Machine-Wide Installer",
    "Microsoft.Office.OneNote",
    "Microsoft.OneNote"
)

# Remove installed packages (user + all users)
foreach ($app in $bloat) {
    Get-AppxPackage -AllUsers | Where-Object { $_.Name -like "*$app*" } | Remove-AppxPackage -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    Get-AppxProvisionedPackage -Online | Where-Object { $_.DisplayName -like "*$app*" } | Remove-AppxProvisionedPackage -Online -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    Get-WmiObject -Query "select * from Win32_Product where Name like '%$app%'" | ForEach-Object { $_.Uninstall() } -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
}

# Manually remove Teams machine-wide installer
$teamsInstaller = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Teams Installer"
if (Test-Path $teamsInstaller) {
    Remove-Item "$teamsInstaller" -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
}

# Nuke auto-startup tasks + registry leftovers
reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\Teams" /f 2>$null
reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\Teams\LoggedInOnce" /f 2>$null
reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Office\OneNote" /f 2>$null
reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\OneNote" /f 2>$null

Write-Host "`n✅ Teams and OneNote have been terminated. They will not rise again." -ForegroundColor Green
```
